title: Ekaterina Mihaylova
text:
Ekaterina Ivanova Mihaylova () (born 24 October 1956) is a <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>n politician, who was the leader of the <a href="Union%20of%20Democratic%20Forces%20%28Bulgaria%29">UDF</a> between 2001 and 2002.
Life.
Mihaylova was born in <a href="Pazardzhik">Pazardzhik</a>, in the family of a <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a> and a <a href="physician">physician</a>. She graduated from <a href="Sofia%20University">Sofia University</a> in 1978 with a degree in legal studies and started working as an attorney in 1980.
Her political career began in the 1990s when she gained prominence as a member of the <a href="Union%20of%20Democratic%20Forces%20%28Bulgaria%29">UDF</a>. Alongside <a href="Yordan%20Sokolov">Yordan Sokolov</a>, she is considered to be among the staunchest supporters of <a href="Ivan%20Kostov">Ivan Kostov</a> and his policies.
In June 2001, Mihaylova succeeded Kostov as the leader of the UDF, but in March 2002 lost her position to <a href="Nadezhda%20Mihaylova">Nadezhda Mihaylova</a> at the 13th national conference of the party. In 2004 she became one of the founders of the <a href="Democrats%20for%20a%20Strong%20Bulgaria">DSB</a>.
Mihaylova has been a member of five <a href="National%20Assembly%20of%20Bulgaria">National Parliaments</a>.
On 6 November 2007, she was honored with the academic title "honorary professor of <a href="New%20Bulgarian%20University">New Bulgarian University</a>" for her significant contributions to the development of the theoretical and practical aspects of Bulgarian parliamentarism.
